title: (35530) Teguise -

title: (35530) Teguise - 11 Calle Garfa

title: (35530) Teguise - 15 Calle Gadifer de la Salle
title_short: (35530) Teguise - 15 Calle Gadifer de la Salle

The parking lot is flat and paved. There is a small supermarket 250m away. For very large vehicles: there is the possibility of parking on a vacant lot which is located on another side of the stadium.

title: (35530) Teguise - 39 Calle José Betancort

description: Night stop.

description: Parking space for several vans / motorhomes. Windy but calm at night.

description: Small pitch a bit out of the way. The driveway is steep and washed out at one point. Probably nothing for campers.

title: (35560) Tenesar -
description: Lonely beautiful place next to Vulcan Blanca and Timanfaya national park. Surrounded by volcanic rock and the unending power of the sea. No difficult gravel path, can be reached with normal vehicles.

title: (35541) Órzola - LZ-1
description: Parking near the white sand beach, quite spacious and with a garbage can

title: (35560) Tenesar -
description: Quiet area to spend the day and fish. sunbathing and being able to release the dogs.

title: (35541) Órzola - LZ-1
description: Parking without camping sign, very quiet and with a beach on the other side of the road. Stunning view!

title: (35541) Haría - LZ-1
description: It is the car park next to the Mojon Blanco and the Charco de las Novias, 5 minutes from the beach, quiet and quite flat, perfect for spending the night and then bathing. Next to the road. Little wind, has garbage containers.

title: (35541) Órzola -
description: Perfect place to stop with a medium sized van or camper. Not far from the beach, but just enough not to suffer the humidity and the strong wind. Very spacious area. Clay.

title: (35541) Orzola - Unnamed Road
description: Incredible location for one night. Breath-taking view. Very wide beach but subject to high tide. Large public parking, easy to access. Nice point for possible excursions or day at the beach.

title: (35541) Órzola -
description: Mini spot pour 1 à 2 voitures. Idéal si vous voulez vous isoler des autres voitures/vans. Superbe vue et plage pas loin.

title: (35541) Haría - LZ-1
description: Beach car park without service. Directly at the sea. Very quiet. Ideal as a starting point for a tour to the neighboring island of La Graciola, for example by bike.

title: (35541) Orzola - 16 Calle Peña de la Pardela
title_short: (35541) Orzola - 16 Calle Peña de la Pardela
description: Area to spend the night, quiet, you can not get anything and you have to respect the maximum (as it should always be)

title: (35560) Tenesar -
description: Accessible via a good gravel road. The view is good and there are not many visitors. There is black sand on the beach. There are rubbish bins but they are quite full.

title: (35541) Orzola - 22 Calle Charco de la Novia
title_short: (35541) Orzola - 22 Calle Charco de la Novia
description: Good parking to catch the boat for the gracious and some bars nothing of services very quiet and safe area

title: (35541) Orzola -
description: Public toilet

title: (35571) Puerto Calero -
description: Laundry. Hours from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.

title: (35571) Puerto Calero - 2A Calle Alegranza
description:
Why this parking lot appears here again and again with its alleged advantages is a mystery. The fact is: Spending the night here is forbidden!

The marina car park is really a few meters from the boats and is ideal for visiting the port and its surroundings. Of course: it's a car park, so no unpacking to do! The parking lot is flat and paved. The pitches are allocated to cars or vans but at the ends you can park one or two motorhomes without any problems. Especially the corner is large and windless. Beginning of March: during the day the car park was 3/4 full. The marina is quite lively with many restaurants, a few shops and a supermarket, but the shops are closed at night and are not directly across from the car park

title: (35571) Puerto Calero - 74 Cortijo Viejo
description: Public, gravelled car park. Beautiful view of the sea.

title: (35570) Puerto Calero -
description: Large parking area in the middle of nature overlooking the ocean a stone's throw from Puerto Calero. In very strong winds it can be dusty.

title: (35570) Yaiza - Carretera Playa Quemada
description: Small place near a semi offroad path.

title: (35570) Yaiza - 15 Calle la Cuesta
description: Possibility to refill water at the service station, free if you get petrol.

title: (35570) Yaiza - 15 Calle las Cuestas
description: It is a land plot next to Vista de Yaiza street. It rests very well, however, you have to take into account the traffic in the mornings.

title: (35570) Yaiza - Calle Garajonay
description: Perfect spot without anyone facing the sea next to the small village for morning coffee. Windy but it's Lanzarote.

title: (35570) Yaiza - 7Bis Calle el Cagancho
description: Large parking lot in the center of Yaïza. Enough space to place a camper, nice view of a square and playground next to it.

title: (35570) Yaiza - 12 Calle el Volcán de Yaiza
title_short: (35570) Yaiza - 12 Calle el Volcán de Yaiza
description: Level parking area without any services, but very quiet.

title: (35570) Yaiza - 2 Calle Garajonay
description: The course is located at the end of Playa Quemada, on the hiking trail to Puerto Calero. 5 min walk to the restaurants in town. Very quiet with great views.

title: (35570) Yaiza - 4 Calle Garajonay
description: Open gravel parking lot. plenty of space between neighboring homes. great view to the ocean

title: (35570) Playa Quemada - 18 Caserio Playa Quemada
description: Nice and quiet place with many places to park. Many restaurants to eat on the beachfront. The entrance to the sea with many stones except for a couple of points where it is a little easier to enter for the bathroom. A beautiful beach of dark sand a little far to walk.

title: (35570) Playa Quemada - 28 Caserio Playa Quemada
description: Spot for one van, mostly flat with beautiful sea view.

title: (35570) Yaiza - 11 Calle Vista de Yaiza / Calle Montaña Almurcia
title_short: (35570) Yaiza - 11 Calle Vista de Yaiza / Calle Montaña Almurcia
description: Earth parking next to the soccer field. Flat and quiet place to spend the night.

address.street: 11 Calle Vista de Yaiza / Calle Montaña Almurcia

title: (35570) El Golfo -
description:
A magnificent spot to spend a day between the sea and the volcano, in peace.
large flat land that can accommodate several vans and caravans

title: (35570) Femés - 44 Avenida a Femes
description: Parking at the edge of a path. Access by the village and a dirt road, easily accessible to medium-sized vehicles. Very exposed to the wind. Warning! do not try to climb higher in a vehicle, only accessible by 4x4. Nice hike of 2 hours to reach the antennas following the path. Above, incredible views of the volcanoes and surroundings. UNIQUE at this place.

title: (35570) Yaiza - 6 LZ-702
description: Parking at the exit of the city, ideal to spend a night with a sunset and an incredible view. The road passes right next to it but the view makes up for everything else! No convenience.

title: (35570) El Golfo - 1 Avenida Marítima
description: Large dirt parking at the entrance to the town of El Golgo from where you can see the sea and the town. From the same car park there are two walkways that lead to two viewpoints to see the Charco Verde. There is no sign that prohibits spending the night, but we only stop to eat and go to the viewpoints. Pretty flat. There is a garbage container.

title: (35570) El Golfo - 2 Avenida Marítima
description: Small town with many restaurants with nice views. Hiking on the rocks is possible.

title: (35570) Las Palmas - LZ-703
description: Beach parking, so it is full during the day, you have to go at nightfall. The beach at 100 meters but inquire beforehand about the currents. When I was there, the road was closed after a kilometer. so the silence was absolute. No services. Van take your toilet paper.

name: Los Hervideros
title: (35570) Los Hervideros
description: Spacious parking with spectacular views, although very open and windy.

title: (35570) Yaiza - LZ-703
description: Large seaside car park in Punta del Volcan, south of El Golfo. Beautiful coast. No service.

title: (35570) Yaiza - 29 Calle la Hoya
description: Great view of the beach. Very quiet place to spend a night

title: (35570) Las Breñas -
description: No official car park but a good place to park and visit the natural baths in the rocks of the west coast. Access via an easily passable gravel road.

title: (35570) Playa Blanca - Carr. Playa Blanca
description:
It is inside the "Clean Point".
It is a sewer with a lid where you can throw the Poti. They do not have a faucet to be able to rinse the Poti afterwards.
The sewer is behind some containers, so you cannot get in the motorhome to open the tap under it and empty the gray water. We throw away the gray water because we made an invention with a hose.
It's a bit sloppy but it's the only alternative we can find in the south of the island.

title: (35580) Yaiza - Unnamed Road
description: Ample parking near the beach, without services. access by dirt road 5kms.

title: (35580) Yaiza - Unnamed Road
description: Right in front of the beach ...

name: Camping Papagayo
title: (35580) Camping Papagayo
description: Little camping near to papagayo beach. It is relatively good protected form the wind. Lots of places available at any time. Showers and sinks available. Electricity and water also available.

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 2 Cl San Sebastian
description: Excellent spot to stop without disturbing noises, shade during the day, spectacular sea view, bathrooms, supermarket and playground 100 meters away in the shopping center.

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 1A Calle Playa de Afre
title_short: (35580) Playa Blanca - 1A Calle Playa de Afre
description: Small free parking, mostly used by locals working in hotels. We stayed there 1 night because sheltered from the wind (more sheltered than the parking already referenced which is in height). Quiet night, the police came to the parking lot and then left (just a courteous round). 2 minutes from a small sheltered beach and access to the path that leads to Papagayo beaches. Rather for vans, not enough room for C.car.

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 29 Calle San Sebastian
description: Quiet parking with beautiful sea views, possibility of walking to the beaches of Papagayo (about 10 minutes to get to beach women). lacks services.

title: (35580) Yaiza - 13 Calle Punta de Papagayo
description: Ample non-leveled dirt road very popular. Nearby restaurant and bar. No service but a wonderful beach

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 22A Avenida de Papagayo
description: New parking lot, today on 06/26/2021 full of motorhomes, without services but close to everything, I do not know how long they will park there

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 35 Calle las Maretas
description: Clean and very quiet laundry

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 2 Calle Monta/a Roja
description: Large dirt parking ideal for visiting Playa Blanca 5 min walk from the main promenade. very quiet at night

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 12 Calle de la Chalana
title_short: (35580) Playa Blanca - 12 Calle de la Chalana
description: Bus station 1.0 health center 1.1 papagayo 5.0 Only to stay if you are going to take the boat to Fuerteventura

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 116 Calle del Chinchorro
description: Parking area to know the beautiful town and to spend the night and to embark the next day because it is next to the entrance to the port.

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 3A Cl la Palma
description: It is an asphalt parking lot and at the end there is a dirt embankment. Right next to it there are some containers and also a small shopping center with a Spar supermarket. Ideal to be able to spend the night the night before taking the boat.

title: (35580) Playa Blanca - 2A Cl Hierro el
description: Free parking and reasonably sheltered from the wind. Well located on the edge of the pedestrian avenue Maritima to make beautiful walks on the seafront. Beach and shops 5 minutes walk. We stayed 3 nights without worries. There were 2 other vans and 1 motorhome

title: (35570) Yaiza - Avenida Faro Pechiguera
description:
Abandoned hotel and natural pools.
This place is amazing for explorers! The huge abandoned Hotel complex from the 70s is private property, so entering it not legal, even though it's easily possible. The coast is high and rocky. If you climb down (people do it with their kids, so not very difficult) you find natural saltwater pools. It depends a bit on the tide if you can/want to swim. Best and safest is going right after high tide, when the water is fresh and clean. 
The road there is a dirt track with quite some stones and rocks. People go there with their regular rental cars, so it's probably doable with a van and a skilled driver. Careful with rain, as it gets very muddy.

title: (35580) Yaiza - 140 Calle Monta/a Roja
description: Place spend the night and beaches

title: (35580) Yaiza - 2H Cl Rumania
description: Perfect parking to watch the sunset and spend the night without problem .. there are no services .. no garbage. beautiful in front of the sea

title: (35580) Yaiza - 176 Calle Monta/a Roja
description: Public parking.
